sub_topic: Finding the area of a sector of a circle.
message_1: A pizza has a diameter of 14 inches. If you eat one-fourth of the pizza, what is the area of the sector of the pizza that you ate? (Round your answer to two decimal places.)
message_2:
To find the area of the sector of the pizza that you ate, we first need to find the area of the entire pizza and then take one-fourth of that area.

The area of a circle can be found using the formula A = πr^2, where A is the area and r is the radius of the circle. Since the diameter of the pizza is 14 inches, the radius is half of that, which is 7 inches.

A = π(7^2)
A = π(49)
A ≈ 153.94 square inches (rounded to two decimal places)

Now, we need to find one-fourth of the area:

Area of sector = (1/4) * 153.94 ≈ 38.49 square inches (rounded to two decimal places)

So, the area of the sector of the pizza that you ate is approximately 38.49 square inches.
